item.title: [Tutorial] Switch Statement
item.dc:creator: @_Nirvana † Nirvana †
item.description:
@_Nirvana wrote:

[quote=“bakatool, post:14, topic:133125”]I learned the more stuff you put in client.java the better your server is!
current leader is 2.78 MB.

this is a nice tutorial you could make it easier to read imo…

switch(nirvanasInt) { case 10: case 23: case 57: case 78: case 99: System.out.println("It was one of teh lucky numbers!"); break;[/quote]

Not really its easier to see them spread rather than on 1 line but that saves space. It could even be:
switch(nirvanasInt){case 10:case 23:case 57:case 78:case 99:System.out.println(“It was one of teh lucky numbers!”);break;

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Switch Statement
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:3, topic:133125”]I’m sure there are plenty of people on both boards who have no idea how to use switch statements - in fact, I know there are, because I’ve seen some godawful massive if-then-else blocks in some supposed “decent” code ;)[/quote]Reminds me of the time PSB tried to convince me nested if-else statements were better. Of course, since it was nearly ago, I was gullible and believed him - and therefore my bytecode library has a 200 line if/else statement. Yay.

Read full topic

I’m sure there are plenty of people on both boards who have no idea how to use switch statements - in fact, I know there are, because I’ve seen some godawful massive if-then-else blocks in some supposed “decent” code
[/quote]

If not, then I still don’t think this tutorial belongs here, it would be greatly appreciated if it was in www.moparisthebest.com/smf

And, in here if you don’t know the basics, you should go back there.[/quote]

And noobs from mopar are like “how do i mek a srvr?” they have no java knowledge and just get flamed.
